property.name: rpc.client.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval of an RPC invocation in milliseconds. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: rpc.client.connect.tcpnodelay
property.description: This parameter indicates whether TCP_NODELAY is set to true for connecting to the RPC server. The default is set to true.

property.name: rpc.client.max.idle
property.description: The max idle time of an RPC connection in milliseconds. The default is set to 10000 (10 seconds).

property.name: rpc.client.ping.interval
property.description: The periodic interval in milliseconds at which the RPC client sends a heart beat to the server. 0 indicates disabled. The default is set to 10000 (10 seconds).

property.name: rpc.client.connect.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the RPC client is trying to setup the connection. The default is set to 600000 (10 minutes).

property.name: rpc.client.connect.retry
property.description: The maximum times to retry if the RPC client fails to setup the connection to the server. The default is set to 10.

property.name: rpc.client.read.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the RPC client is trying to read from the server. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: rpc.client.write.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the RPC client is trying to write to the server. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: rpc.client.socket.linger.timeout
property.description: The value to be set for socket SO_LINGER when connecting to the RPC server. The default value is -1.

property.name: dfs.client.read.shortcircuit
property.description: If set to true the datanode is bypassed when reading file blocks, if the block and the client are on the same node. The default is set to true.

property.name: dfs.default.replica
property.description: The default number of replicas. The default is set to 3.

property.name: dfs.prefetchsize
property.description: The default number of blocks for which information will be pre-fetched. The default is set to 10.

property.name: dfs.client.failover.max.attempts
property.description: The maximum number of times to retry when the dfs client is trying to issue an RPC call, if multiple namenodes are configured. The default is set to 15.

property.name: dfs.default.blocksize
property.description: The default block size in bytes. The default is set to 134217728 (128 MB).

property.name: dfs.client.log.severity
property.description: The minimal log severity level, valid values include FATAL, ERROR, INFO, DEBUG1, DEBUG2, DEBUG3. The default is set to INFO.

property.name: input.connect.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the input stream is trying to setup the connection to a datanode. The default is set to 600000 (10 minutes).

property.name: input.read.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the input stream is trying to read from a datanode. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: input.write.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the input stream is trying to write to a datanode. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: input.localread.default.buffersize
property.description: The buffer size in bytes which is to be used to hold the data from the file block and to verify the checksum. It is only used when 'dfs.client.read.shortcircuit' is set to true. The default is set to 1048576 (1 MB).

property.name: input.localread.blockinfo.cachesize
property.description: The size of file block path information cache in bytes. The default is set to 1000 bytes.

property.name: input.read.getblockinfo.retry
property.description: The maximum number of times to retry when the client fails to get block information from the namenode. The default is set to 3.

property.name: output.replace-datanode-on-failure
property.description: If set to true, the client adds a new datanode into pipeline if the number of nodes in the pipeline is less than the specified number of replicas. The default is set to true.

property.name: output.default.chunksize
property.description: The chunk size (in bytes) in the pipeline. The default is set to 512 bytes.

property.name: output.default.packetsize
property.description: The packet size (in bytes) in the pipeline. The default is set to 65536 (64 kB).

property.name: output.default.write.retry
property.description: The maximum number of times to retry when the client fails to set up the pipeline. The default is set to 10.

property.name: output.connect.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the output stream is trying to setup the connection to a datanode. The default is set to 600000 (10 minutes).

property.name: output.read.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the output stream is trying to read from a datanode. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: output.write.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when the output stream is trying to write to a datanode. The default is set to 3600000 (1 hour).

property.name: output.packetpool.size
property.description: The maximum number of packets in a file's packet pool. The default is set to 1024.

property.name: output.close.timeout
property.description: The timeout interval in milliseconds when closing an output stream. The default is set to 900000 (1.5 hour).

property.name: dfs.domain.socket.path
property.description: Optional: This is the path to a UNIX domain socket that will be used for communication between the datanode and local HDFS clients. If the string "_PORT" is present in this path, it will be replaced by the TCP port of the datanode.

property.name: dfs.client.use.legacy.blockreader.local
property.description: If this configuration is set to true, the legacy short-circuit reader implementation based on HDFS-2246 is used. This implementation is used on platforms other than Linux which does not have the new implementation based on HDFS-347.
